function_reachability: Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Is it possible that the loop with condition 'i < 5' is never executed?
Is the loop with condition 'i < 5' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'a < i' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'a < i' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < 5' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'a < i' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Is variable 'i (line 4)' used after its definition?
Is variable 'j (line 4)' used after its definition?
liveness: Is variable 'i' live at the end of function 'main'?
Does variable 'j' remain in use at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Is the statement 'for (i = 0; i < 5; i++)' unreachable?
Can the program actually reach the statement: “for (j = 0; j < 5; j++)”?
